category.motivation: The article reports significant changes in profitability for specific Chinese energy companies driven by falling coal prices, effectively describing company earnings outcomes for the first half of the year.

time_frame.motivation: The article reports on first‑half‑of‑year performance and immediate impacts of falling coal prices on Chinese chemicals producers, reflecting short‑term market dynamics.

article_node.title: China’s Chemicals Makers Reap Reward of Shift From Oil to Coal
article_node.summary: Falling coal prices are reshaping China’s chemicals industry, boosting profitability for coal‑to‑chemicals producers while hurting oil‑based refineries.  In the first half of the year, Ningxia Baofeng Energy Group Co. saw profits jump 73%, and China Shenhua Energy Co. reported a near 20‑fold increase at its Inner Mongolia plant.  Conversely, Sinopec’s chemicals unit lost 4.5 billion yuan, a larger hit than the 3.6 billion yuan loss in the same period last year.
